item.title: Laura add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "There are causes worth dying for, but none worth killing for." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "We're all going to die, all of us, what a circus! That alone should make us love each other but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities, we are eaten up by nothing." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Laura add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "To find yourself, think for yourself." -- Socrates

item.title: Laura add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "If he needs a million acres to make him feel rich, seems to me he needs it 'cause he feels awful poor inside hisself, and if he's poor in hisself, there ain't no million acres gonna make him feel rich, an' maybe he's disappointed that nothin' he can do 'll make him feel rich." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Laura add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "I warn you that when the princes of this world start loving you it means they are going to grind you up into battle sausage." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: Laura add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Laura add a quote by Alain de Botton
item.description: "There are things that are not spoken about in polite society. Very quickly in most conversations you'll reach a moment where someone goes, 'Oh, that's a bit heavy,' or 'Eew, disgusting.' And literature is a place where that stuff goes; where people whisper to each other across books, the writer to the reader. I think that stops you feeling lonely – in the deeper sense, lonely." -- Alain de Botton

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Laura add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charlie Brooker
item.description: "Many people find bald, unvarnished truths so disturbing, they prefer to ram their heads in the sand and start dreaming at the first sign of scientific reality." -- Charlie Brooker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charlie Brooker
item.description:
"Must be frustrating being a scientist. There you are, incrementally discovering how the universe works via a series of complex tests and experiments, for the benefit of all mankind - and what thanks do you get? People call you "egghead" or "boffin" or "heretic", and they cave your face in with a rock and bury you out in the wilderness.
Not literally - not in this day and age - but you get the idea. Scientists are mistrusted by huge swathes of the general public, who see them as emotionless lab-coated meddlers-with-nature rather than, say, fellow human beings who've actually bothered getting off their arses to work this shit out. " -- Charlie Brooker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are going to die, and that makes us the lucky ones. Most people are never going to die because they are never going to be born. The potential people who could have been here in my place but who will in fact never see the light of day outnumber the sand grains of Arabia. Certainly those unborn ghosts include greater poets than Keats, scientists greater than Newton. We know this because the set of possible people allowed by our DNA so massively exceeds the set of actual people. In the teeth of these stupefying odds it is you and I, in our ordinariness, that are here.We privileged few, who won the lottery of birth against all odds, how dare we whine at our inevitable return to that prior state from which the vast majority have never stirred?" -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "When I looked at you, my life made sense. Even the bad things made sense. They were necessary to make you possible." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Laura add a quote by A.A. Milne
Laura add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "I swear to you gentlemen, that to be overly conscious is a sickness, a real, thorough sickness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charlie Brooker
item.description: "it's spider season. Every year, right about now, thousands of the godless eight-legged bastards emerge from the bowels of hell (or the garden, whichever's nearest) with the sole intention of tormenting humankind." -- Charlie Brooker

item.title: Laura add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to be alone than in bad company." -- George Washington

item.title: Laura add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which." -- George Orwell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Laura add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "What we are doing to the forests of the world is but a mirror reflection of what we are doing to ourselves and to one another." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Laura add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "We are being made aware that the organization of society on the principle of private profit, as well as public destruction, is leading both to the deformation of humanity by unregulated industrialism, and to the exhaustion of natural resources, and that a good deal of our material progress is a progress for which succeeding generations may have to pay dearly." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Laura add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Everything has been figured out, except how to live." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Laura add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "It was a joy! Words weren't dull, words were things that could make your mind hum. If you read them and let yourself feel the magic, you could live without pain, with hope, no matter what happened to you." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Laura add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "When men can hate without risk, their stupidity is easily convinced, the motives supply themselves." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: Laura add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "We've no use for intellectuals in this outfit. What we need is chimpanzees. Let me give you a word of advice: never say a word to us about being intelligent. We will think for you, my friend. Don't forget it." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline
